subject: [HW 06] Q3: Sign
content:
Q3: Sign

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q3: Sign in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: im trying to follow the same syntax as the textbook, but i get this error:                scm> (sign -42)     # Error: int is not callable: -1          # Error: expected     #     -1     # but got     #     Traceback (most recent call last):     #       ...     #     SchemeError: int is not callable: -1  looks like im getting the same number -1, but instead of returning it im calling something on the number?

follow-ups.feedback: Probably somewhere in your code, you have something that looks like `(-1)`. This is treated as a call expression in Scheme. Try removing the parenthesis if you have them or write it like `(- 1)` (with a space after the dash) so Scheme can use the subtraction operator.

Just to clarify, `-1` and `(- 1)` both evaluate to -1 because when only a single argument is provided to the subtraction operator, it outputs that argument negated, so `(- 1)` outputs 1 negated which is -1.

threads.question: Can someone please give me a hint on what this means?  scm> (cond ((= 1 1) 42))

follow-ups.feedback: Take a look at the cond expression documentation [here](https://cs61a.org/lab/lab09//#cond-expressions)

threads.question: scm> (load-all ".")  # Error: unexpected end of file  What does this mean? All my previous cases that passed are no longer passing

follow-ups.feedback: are you getting the same 'urllib3' error as other students also?

threads.question: Traceback (most recent call last):   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main   "__main__", mod_spec)   File "/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.7/lib/python3.7/runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code   exec(code, run_globals)   File "ok/__main__.py", line 14, in <module>   File "ok/client/cli/ok.py", line 48, in <module>   File "ok/client/api/assignment.py", line 3, in <module>   File "ok/client/utils/auth.py", line 5, in <module>   File "ok/requests/__init__.py", line 43, in <module>   ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'urllib3'

follow-ups.feedback: I passed Q2, but when I met this error on Q3, Q2 also met also error.
I'm having this issue with the entire homework right now! :(
